title: Understanding Entropy
text: Entropy is a measure of the disorder or randomness in a system. When a gas is compressed, think about how the particles are affected.

title: Effect of Compression on Gas Particles
text: When a gas is compressed into a smaller volume, the particles have less space to move around. Consider how this affects the disorder of the system.

title: Entropy and Volume Relationship
text: Entropy is directly related to the volume available to gas particles. If the volume decreases, what happens to the entropy?

title: Predicting Entropy Change
text: Think about whether the system becomes more ordered or disordered when the volume is reduced. How does this affect the sign of the entropy change?

title: Final Consideration
text: Remember that a decrease in disorder (or increase in order) typically results in a negative change in entropy. Apply this concept to the compression of carbon dioxide gas.
